newsitem.title: RUSSIA: PreussenElektra won't up Russian Lenenergo share.
newsitem.headline: PreussenElektra won't up Russian Lenenergo share.

text.p: Veba AG's PreussenElektra AG utility will not increase its five percent stake in Russian utility AOOT Lenenergo for the time being, the chairman of the German utility said.
Hans-Dieter Harig told a news conference on Wednesday it would not increase its holdings, acquired for 10 million marks.
But Harig said the two companies intended to take seats on each other's boards and the companies planned to form a joint venture to rebuild two St Petersburg power stations.

PreussenElektra and Lenenergo, which supplies power to the St Petersburg region, on Tuesday signed a protocol of cooperation, but it was not clear if the board representation and joint venture plans were included in this.
Lenenergo president Semyon Kazarov said his company had looked for a foreign investor because it did not have enough resources of its own to modernise the old power stations.
He added that estimates of the cost of the project had not yet been completed.
